creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
If <apply> is a fileset-iterative approach to <exec>, then shouldn't Ant core 
include a TaskContainer that works in the same way?  An implementation might 
include ideas from <apply>, <foreach> and <macrodef>.

creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
There is a new <for/> task in ant-contrib cvs which is a combo of
<foreach> and <macrodef/>

<for param="x" list="a,b,c,d">
  <sequential>
    <echo>x is ${x}</echo>
  </sequential>
</for>

<for param="file">
   <path>
      <fileset dir="src" includes="**/*.xml"/>
   </path>
   <sequential>
      <echo>file is ${file}</echo>
   </sequential>
</for>

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text: Will ant-contrib's <for> also adopt @{} attribute notation?

Yes,
It uses the macrodef task as a basis for the iteration.
creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
mbenson@apache.org
text:
While we could debate all day whether this particular ant-contrib task truly 
belongs in Ant core, at least the functionality should be available.  So if it

Hard to choose a resolution that equals "viable alternative exists."  I'll pick
